title: Austronesian peoples
summary: The Austronesian peoples, sometimes referred to as Austronesian-speaking peoples,[43] are a large group of peoples in Madagascar,[44] Maritime Southeast Asia, Micronesia, coastal New Guinea, Island Melanesia, Polynesia, and Taiwan that speak Austronesian languages. The nations and territories predominantly populated by Austronesian-speaking peoples are sometimes known collectively as Austronesia.[45]
